# Task

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
using Base.Threads: @threads

function pig_latinify(words::Vector{String})
    result = Vector{String}(undef, length(words))

    @threads for (i, word) in enumerate(words)
        if startswith(word, "qu")
            # Handle "qu" as a special case
            new_word = "$wordway"
        else
            new_word = "$(word[2:end])ay"
            if !isempty(word[1:1])
                new_word = "$word[1] $new_word"
            end
        end
        result[i] = new_word
    end

    return result
end
```

This function defines a vector `result` of the same length as `words` to store the transformed strings. It then uses the `@threads` macro from the `Threads` module to parallelize the transformation over each word in the `words` vector using separate threads. Within the threaded loop, it handles the special case of words starting with "qu" and otherwise follows the pig latin rules for transforming the rest of the word.
